intro: Avenastrum quinquenerve, commonly known as the five-veined grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves with five distinct veins. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Avenastrum quinquenerve is adapted to arid environments, exhibiting features that help it conserve water and withstand drought conditions.
